title: Is it 'reaching the airport' or 'reaching at the airport'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Original question: Is it "reaching the airport" or "reaching at the airport"? The first one (“reaching the airport”) is correct. “Reaching” means “arriving at.” Replace it in your phrases and see which one is correct: (A) “[arriving at] the airport” (B) “[arriving at] at the airport” (A) is correct and (B) is wrong.

If you mean ‘getting to the airport’ it is ‘reaching the airport.’ ‘Reaching’ here means ‘arrival.’ If you say ‘reaching at the airport’ you need more words—-what are you reaching? A possibility might be ‘reaching my destination at the airport I ran to catch my flight.’
